title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 64.11 - Licenses and reports required in purchase or sale of receipts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 64.11 - Licenses and reports required in purchase or sale of receipts

State Regulations
(a) No manufacturer
or wholesaler shall sell, offer for sale, agree to sell, or purchase in this

State any warehouse receipts representing liquor or wine stored in this State
or stored in another state but intended for shipment into this State unless
both the purchaser and the seller are duly licensed by the Liquor

Authority. (b) Each transaction
between a manufacturer or wholesaler in this State and a person within, or
without this State, involving the purchase or sale of warehouse receipts
representing liquor or wiine stored within this State or stored outside the

State and intended for shipment into this State, shall be reported to the

Liquor Authority within 10 days after the transaction has been consummated. Such report shall set forth the name and address of the seller, the name and
address of the of the purchaser, the license numbers, if any, of the purchaser
and seller, the name and address of the warehouse in which the liquor or wine
is stored, the warehouse in which the liquor or wine is stored, the warehouse
receipt numbers, an accurate description of the quantity and type of liquor or
wine represented by each such warehouse receipt, and the name and address of
the place to which such liquor or wine is to be shipped. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

64.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
